subject: Data
title: Meta-Analysis: Combining All the Evidence
description: A fast breakdown of Meta-Analysis: Combining All the Evidence for builders.

hook.text: One small study says coffee prevents cancer. Another says it causes cancer. How do you decide?

buildup.text: Meta-analysis combines results from many studies, weighting each by size and quality, into one conclusion.

discovery.text: Gene Glass coined the term in 1976, arguing that pooling studies yields more reliable answers than any single one.

twist.text: But 'garbage in, garbage out' â€” combining biased studies produces a precise but wrong answer.

climax.text: Meta-analyses now sit at the top of the evidence hierarchy and guide medical treatment worldwide.

punchline.text: One study is a clue. A thousand studies are a verdict.

quiz.question: What does a meta-analysis do?
options: Runs the largest possible single experiment
Combines results from many studies into one conclusion
